channel.title: "Error connecting to server" But idk what the problem is
channel.description:
I'm posting this here because I don't think my VPS company will really dig the whole RSPS vibe.
So basically, I have been working on my RSPS called RareScape, it is on a fully functioning VPS (1GB RAM, DDoS protected, 4TB bandwidth etc), I port forwarded, Firewall enabled port, Changed my IP on the server to my NO-IP' IP.
The weird thing is the server works fine, But randomly while me and 3 other people are on we get DCed, and I check my VPS to see if everything is working and it is, everything should be doing its job. I have to close my NO-IP and re-open it then wait like 6 minutes for it to start working again.
Is it my VPS? Or is No-IP not compatible with VPS'? Or something else idk just help me please. Thanks.

item.title: "Error connecting to server" But idk what the problem is
item.dc:creator: @arean arean
item.description:
@arean wrote:

I don’t think so. The VPS company is a pretty big one, they provided me with one IP address but I’m really not sure on the disconnecting thing.

Read full topic
item.source: "Error connecting to server" But idk what the problem is

item.title: "Error connecting to server" But idk what the problem is
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Sounds like your VPS doesn’t have a static IP address? Does the IP address change when you get disconnected? If this is the case then you have a terrible host.

Read full topic
item.source: "Error connecting to server" But idk what the problem is
